KnowledgeBase.Title: isCharUppercase
KnowledgeBase.ArgumentTypes: Character String Symbol Vector ByteVector Text Boolean
KnowledgeBase.RelatedFunctions: isType isChar isCharAlphanumeric isCharLowercase isCharName isCharNumeric isCharAlphabetic isCharWhitespace isString isText
KnowledgeBase.HumanKeywords: Character Alphabetic Object Uppercase Lowercase Name Underscore Numeric Alphanumeric Name Whitespace Boolean

Function.Description: The isCharUppercase function returns true if every character in the argument is an uppercase character; otherwise false is returned.

Brief.Overview: The isCharUppercase function returns true if every character in the argument {obj} is an uppercase character. Otherwise the isCharUppercase function returns false.
Brief.Usage: The isCharUppercase function function is used to query an object to see if it contains only uppercase characters.

Argument.Name: obj
Argument.AISTypes: Character String Symbol Vector ByteVector Text Boolean

Syntax.Return: If the object contains only uppercase characters, true is returned. Otherwise false is returned.
